column4: Can anyone help me with my 'no sound' issue? The card seems be be o.k. I read some googled tutorials but I don't know how to fix, still
I did that tutorial to the 'alsa' script point. Everything seems to be ok, but no sound. Will I have to install manually?
I pasted the output from the alsa script above. Would you be so kind to have a look at it?
I make no promises makro, but I'll take a look -- it might be something easy I can help you fix :-D
I hope so... Maybe we're licky. Here the link again: http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=b3c34d5cc74b3b55a8fa97b948472101623978e9
looks normal, the dmesg log doesn't have any alsa-related error messages
has sound ever worked on your current setup?
the pulseaudio system loses sound sometimes, killall pulseaudio and an application restart usually fixes this
no, it's a vitgin 11.4 install. On my old system (linux, too) sound worked correctly
hmm, the link https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SoundTroubleshooting isn't so much a script as a series of steps to fix audio issues, did you follow the troubleshooting tips?
Yes, I did follow the tutorial step by step, until the point 'alsa-script'. In did not do the 'manual install' part
killing and restarting pulseaudio did not fix the isue
I'm looking at the page, is alsa script mentioned here? I get no results on the keyword
I refer to the topic: Is ALSA using the correct model?
enter those two items under the options line in the alsa-configuration.txt and run sudo alsa force-reload
I'm running 11.04 too, if you're having any trouble locating the files listed in the troubleshooting guide just holler and I'll be right on it :-)
I added the line 'options snd-hda-intel model=3stack-digout' to /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf and restarted alsa. No effect. What this the action you meant?
Sorry, I have to go. Thank you for helping, so long. I'll retry later
